definition: to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
to blaze a new trail (idiom); to display originality

sentences.english: We have to find another way, because this one does not work.
sentences.chinese: 办法是不可行的，我们只能别开蹊径。

sentences.english: Some of Xinran's interactions are extraordinary.
sentences.chinese: 欣然女士作品的一些互动独辟蹊径。

sentences.english: They planed to branch off into building their own new house.
sentences.chinese: 他们计划独辟蹊径，盖自己的新房。

sentences.english: The budget the Democrats passed this week charts a new course.
sentences.chinese: 民主党这个星期通过的预算将另辟蹊径。

sentences.english: For a final project, we wanted to take a different tact.
sentences.chinese: 由于是最后一个项目，我们想另辟蹊径。

sentences.english: But a community choir in Vermont is trying something different.
sentences.chinese: 但是佛蒙特州的一个社区唱诗班却是独辟蹊径。

sentences.english: Johnson and Aouita blazed their way to the top of track and field .
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊和阿乌伊塔各辟蹊径，跻身田径比赛榜首。

sentences.english: Deliberately push yourself out of your routine. Try things that you do not normally try.
sentences.chinese: 要刻意去另辟蹊径，尝试那些你平时没试过的东西。

sentences.english: We are transformed into crisscrossed paths on the plain.
sentences.chinese: 化成平原上交错的蹊径。

sentences.english: And lives of the pedestrians on the paths.
sentences.chinese: 化成蹊径上行人的生命。

sentences.english: People will move sideways to do different jobs.
sentences.chinese: 人们能够另辟蹊径，接触到各种不同的工作。

definition: to have a style of one's own
brush stroke to the side (calligraphy)/fig. side stroke/lateral thinking
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
to diverge from the main road, also figuratively
not follow the beaten track/have an original style
winding road (twisting and turning like a sheep's intestine)
lit. lock the door and search for the right word (idiom); fig. the serious hard work of writing
